com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document

Class SpenObjectStroke

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectBase
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectStroke

  • public final class SpenObjectStroke
extends SpenObjectBase
    SpenObjectStroke class. This class represents a stroke object and provides methods for managing strokes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int TOOL_TYPE_ERASER
      Stroke creation with the eraser.
      static int TOOL_TYPE_FINGER
      Stroke creation with a finger.
      static int TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE
      Stroke creation with a mouse.
      static int TOOL_TYPE_SPEN
      Stroke creation with a S-Pen.
      static int TOOL_TYPE_UNKNOWN
      Unknown tool.

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(boolean isTemplateObject)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified template status.
        Parameters:
        isTemplateObject - Set to true to create a template object, set to false to create a non-template object.

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(String penName)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified pen.
        For more details on penName, see setPenName(String).
        Parameters:
        penName - The name of the pen.
        See Also:
        setPenName(String)

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(String penName,
                boolean isTemplateObject)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified pen and template status.
        For more details on penName, see setPenName(String).
        Parameters:
        penName - The name of the pen.
        isTemplateObject - Set to true to create a template object, set to false to create a non-template object.
        See Also:
        setPenName(String)

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(String penName,
                PointF[] points,
                float[] pressures,
                int[] timestamps)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified pen, stroke points, pressures, and time-stamps.
        For more details on penName, see setPenName(String). And, for more details on points, pressures, and timestamps, see setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[]).
        If the lengths of the points, pressures, and timestamps arrays are not equal, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        penName - The name of the pen.
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps.
        See Also:
        setPenName(String), setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

      • SpenObjectStroke

        public SpenObjectStroke(String penName,
                PointF[] points,
                float[] pressures,
                int[] timestamps,
                boolean isTemplateObject)
        Creates an SpenObjectStroke instance with the specified pen, stroke points, pressures, timestamps and template status.
        For more details on penName, see setPenName(String). And, for more details on points, pressures, and timestamps, see setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[]).
        If the lengths of the points, pressures, and timestamps arrays are not equal, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        penName - The name of the pen.
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps.
        isTemplateObject - Set to true to create a template object, set to false to create a non-template object.
        See Also:
        setPenName(String), setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

    • Method Detail

      • setPenName

        public void setPenName(String penName)
        Set the specified name for the pen.
        penName is the pen ID for a stroke.
        Parameters:
        penName - The name for the pen.
        See Also:
        getPenName()

      • getPenName

        public String getPenName()

        The name of the pen.
        See Also:
        setPenName(String)

      • setAdvancedPenSetting

        public void setAdvancedPenSetting(String penStyle)
        Set the advanced pen settings.
        Use this method for setting pen advanced settings. But, the preloaded pens don't have any advanced pen setting.
        Parameters:
        penStyle - The pen style.
        See Also:
        getAdvancedPenSetting()

      • getAdvancedPenSetting

        public String getAdvancedPenSetting()
        Get the advanced pen settings.
        Use this method for getting pen advanced settings. But, the preloaded pens don't have any advanced pen setting.
        Returns:
        The pen advanced settings.
        See Also:
        setAdvancedPenSetting(String)

      • setPoints

        public void setPoints(PointF[] points,
             float[] pressures,
             int[] timestamps)
        Set the specified stroke coordinate points.
        You can set null into pressure or time-stamp parameter to remove the information.

        CAUTION :
        Even if points are set, this method does not update the rectangle information of the region.
        Call the setRect(RectF,boolean) method for the region.
        If the lengths of the points, pressures, and timestamps arrays are not equal, an IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        points - The array of stroke points.
        pressures - The array of stroke pressures.
        timestamps - The array of stroke timestamps.
        See Also:
        getPoints()

      • getPoints

        public PointF[] getPoints()
        Get the stroke points.
        Returns:
        The array of stroke points.
        See Also:
        setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

      • getPressures

        public float[] getPressures()
        Get the stroke pressures.
        The length of the pressures array is equal to the length of the points array.
        Returns:
        The array of stroke pressures.
        See Also:
        setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

      • getTimeStamps

        public int[] getTimeStamps()
        Get the stroke timestamps.
        The length of the timestamps array is equal to the length of the points array.
        Returns:
        The array of stroke timestamps.
        See Also:
        setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(PointF pos,
            float pressure,
            int timestamp)
        Add the specified point, pressure and timestamp in the last position.
        If pressure or timestamp has not been set, it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        pos - The stroke point coordinates.
        pressure - The stroke pressure.
        timestamp - The timestamp.
        See Also:
        setPoints(PointF[], float[], int[])

      • setRect

        public void setRect(RectF rect,
           boolean regionOnly)
        Description copied from class: SpenObjectBase
        Set the specified rectangle for the region.
        Use this method to resize and move the region. In general, set regionOnly to true to create an object and save its position.
        After adding the object to SpenPageDoc, set regionOnly to false to resize or move the internal data along with the object.
        Overrides:
        setRect in class SpenObjectBase
        Parameters:
        rect - The rectangle of region.
        regionOnly - Set to true to not allow the internal data to be changed, set to false to let rectangle change the internal data.

        public void setColor(int color)
        Set the specified stroke color.
        Parameters:
        color - The ARGB8888 format color.

      • setPenSize

        public void setPenSize(float size)
        Set the stroke line width.
        Parameters:
        size - The line width in pixels
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the size passed is less than 0.
        See Also:
        getPenSize()

      • getPenSize

        Get the stroke line width
        Returns:
        The stroke line width in pixels.
        See Also:

      • setCurveEnabled

        public void setCurveEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable curved lines.
        Parameters:
        enable - Set to true to enable curves, set to false to disable curves. The default property is true. If you set this to false, this stroke line is drawn as a straight line.
        See Also:
        isCurveEnabled()

      • isCurveEnabled

        public boolean isCurveEnabled()
        Check if curved lines are enabled for this instance.
        Returns:
        true, if curves are enabled.
        false, if curves are not enabled.
        See Also:
        setCurveEnabled(boolean)

      • setToolType

        public void setToolType(int toolType)
        Set the specified stroke tool type.
        Parameters:
        toolType - The stroke tool type.
        The valid values are:
        TOOL_TYPE_FINGER, TOOL_TYPE_SPEN, TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE, TOOL_TYPE_ERASER.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the toolType passed is invalid.
        See Also:
        TOOL_TYPE_FINGER, TOOL_TYPE_SPEN, TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE, TOOL_TYPE_ERASER, getToolType()

      • getToolType

        public int getToolType()
        Get the stroke tool type.
        Returns:
        The stroke tool type.
        The valid values are:
        TOOL_TYPE_FINGER, TOOL_TYPE_SPEN, TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE, TOOL_TYPE_ERASER.
        See Also:
        TOOL_TYPE_FINGER, TOOL_TYPE_SPEN, TOOL_TYPE_MOUSE, TOOL_TYPE_ERASER, setToolType(int)
